dc:title:
On Pilgrimage,
September
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Calls picketing and demonstrating works of mercy--"rebuking the sinner, enlightening the ignorant, counseling the doubtful." Reflects on the challenge of over-mechanization and urges changing over to more "living criteria" for life. Contrasts the noise of New York with the quiet of the farm, a good atmosphere for prayer and reading--"refreshment, light, and peace."
